chargeHist.descr: Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker

result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua L. ROEPKE was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obstruct officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua L. ROEPKE

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt:
Defendant waives his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for trial.
The State moves to amend the charge to obstruct officer, contrary to Section 946.41(1) of the Wisconsin Statutes.  Motion granted.
NO CONTEST plea entered to the amended charge of obstruct officer. Convicted.
The Court sentences the defendant to the Manitowoc County Jail for one hundred sixty-four (164) days, time served.
The defendant has credit for 164 days.
$443.00 court costs imposed, to be paid by 02-04-2020 or 9 days county jail for failure to pay.
DNA sample ordered.
Minutes.

The report finds the defendant is now competent to proceed in this matter.
The parties stipulate to the findings in the report.
The Court finds the defendant has regained competency and reinstates these proceedings.  The Court orders the defendant released from custody.
Preliminary hearing is set for 12-04-19 at 3:00 p.m.
Minutes.

Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum and Order to Sheriff to transport defendant for Competency Hearing on 11-18-19 at 4:00 p.m.   
Copy filed.
Competency hearing on November 18, 2019 at 04:00 pm.
Letter from Atty. Larson to Judge Dietz.
Report of Ana Garcia, Ph.D.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Testimony presented.
The Court finds that the State has met its burden that the defendant is not able to assist in his own defense. 
The Court finds that the defendant is not yet legally competent.
The Court also finds that involuntary medication order is necessary. 
The Court continues the medication order and commitment. 
Review hearing set for 01-14-2020 at 1:30 p.m. 
Minutes.
Competency hearing on January 14, 2020 at 01:30 pm.

Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum and Order to Sheriff to transport defendant for a review hearing on 10-10-19 at 11:00 a.m. in Branch 2.
Copy filed.
Review hearing on October 10, 2019 at 11:00 am.

Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum and Order to Sheriff to transport defendant for a review hearing on 10-04-19 at 10:00 a.m.
Copy filed.
Report of Ana Garcia, Ph.D.
Review hearing on October 4, 2019 at 10:00 am.
Letter from Ana Garcia, Ph.D. to Judge Dietz.
Outpatient Competency Restoration Program

Court finds the defendant is incompetent but with treatment may become competent and that there be an involuntary treatment of medication.   Court orders the proceedings suspended.   Defendant is committed to the Department of Health Services for an indeterminate term not to exceed 12 months.    Review 07-01-19 at 4:00 p.m.   
Minutes.
Order of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency)
Report of Elliott Lee, M.D., Ph.D.
Fax transmittal cover page.

Case recalled at 2:40 p.m.  Defendant is not present.
Competency raised by defense.  Court orders a competency examination.
Status conference is set for 04-01-19 at 10:45 a.m.
Court will draft order.
Minutes.

At 10:16 a.m. case called.  No appearance by defendant.  Defense raises competency.  Case will be recalled at 2:30 p.m. this afternoon.
Minutes.

No appearance by defendant.  Attorney Ann Larson appearing.  Initial appearance is adjourned to 02-25-19 at 1:30 p.m. in Branch 2 due to the snowstorm.

ORIGINAL warrant found and returned to Clerk of Court office.

ADDRESS INFO for Joshua L. ROEPKE
Current: 1751 Lilac Drive, Manitowoc, WI 54220 United States  (Effective: 01-22-2019)
Prior: 2336 Roosevelt Avenue, Manitowoc, WI 54220

BAIL HEARING -
Defendant in custody on arrest warrant and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The matter is continued for an initial appearance on 0-28-19 at :30 p.m. Bail is set at $1,000.00 recognizance bond with the condition that he report to the Two Rivers City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 48 hours or, if incarcerated, within 72 hours of release.  Bail furnished and the defendant released from custody.
Arrest warrant with service of officer thereon.
